fieldDefinitions.metadataFormatVersion: Version of the metadata schema used
fieldDefinitions.headline: Title of the work
fieldDefinitions.author: Author name
fieldDefinitions.datePublished: Date of publication in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)
fieldDefinitions.keywords: Tags and concepts associated with the work; INCLUDE the phase
fieldDefinitions.url: Canonical URL of the Substack post
fieldDefinitions.timeFelt: Phase context with timestamp and phase name
fieldDefinitions.whyItMatters: Why this piece matters in your larger Bloom
fieldDefinitions.sourceFragments: Quoted lines/notes that anchor the piece
fieldDefinitions.associatedMedia: Array of media objects with description and optional contentUrl
fieldDefinitions.generatedBy: Tool and date that generated this metadata

headline: Creature of God. As I Shifted.
description: A locust-vision encounter rendered in sudden poetic clarity: plague and beauty collide, revealing even the swarm as a creature of God.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
whyItMatters: This poem distills a fleeting encounter into revelation: even terror and swarm are bound in God’s making. Red Moon Rising captures the molten emergence of vision—plague, ruckus, beauty, divinity—compressed into one frame.

motifMap.meaning: Disruption; intrusion of the divine in noise
Nature’s mechanical beauty; swarm in motion
Recognition of divine authorship even in dread

articleExcerpt: Shuddering, I looked upon their beauty: a creature of God.

sourceFragments.quote: Today I saw two locust shaking their wings—

sourceFragments.note: Transformation of natural event into biblical imagery

sourceFragments.quote: Shuddering, I looked upon their beauty: a creature of God.

associatedMedia.description: No image specified in post (text-only poem).
